attributes.action: ask the Football Association to urgently review the Cup Final ticket allocation to Manchester United and Chelsea Football Clubs
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Manchester United and Chelsea Football Clubs have each been allocated around 25,000 tickets for the FA Cup Final between the two clubs on May 19th, against a capacity of 90,000 at the new Wembley Stadium. This is a ridiculously small number, given that Manchester United have a ground capacity of around 76000 and Chelsea around 42000, leading to very many genuine football fans being disappointed on the day of the Cup Final.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "ask the Football Association to urgently review the Cup Final ticket allocation to Manchester United and Chelsea Football Clubs."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number-10.gov.uk/output/Page11806.asp

Prime Minister's Office
